013package org.apache.juneau.uon;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018import java.io.*;
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.nio.charset.*;
021import java.util.*;
022import java.util.function.*;
023
024import org.apache.juneau.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
031
032/**
033 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link UonParser}.
034 *
035 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
036 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe and is typically discarded after one use.
037 * </ul>
038 *
039 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
040 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/UonBasics">UON Details</a>
041
042 * </ul>
043 */
044@SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
045public class UonParserSession extends ReaderParserSession implements HttpPartParserSession {
046
047   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
048   // Static
049   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
050
051   // Characters that need to be preceded with an escape character.
052   private static final AsciiSet escapedChars = AsciiSet.of("~'\u0001\u0002");
053
054   private static final char AMP='\u0001', EQ='\u0002';  // Flags set in reader to denote & and = characters.
055
056   /**
057    * Creates a new builder for this object.
058    *
059    * @param ctx The context creating this session.
060    * @return A new builder.
061    */
062   public static Builder create(UonParser ctx) {
063      return new Builder(ctx);
064   }
065
066   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
067   // Builder
068   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
069
070   /**
071    * Builder class.
072    */
073   @FluentSetters
074   public static class Builder extends ReaderParserSession.Builder {
075
076      UonParser ctx;
077      boolean decoding;
078
079      /**
080       * Constructor
081       *
082       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
083       */
084      protected Builder(UonParser ctx) {
085         super(ctx);
086         this.ctx = ctx;
087         decoding = ctx.decoding;
088      }
089
090      @Override
091      public UonParserSession build() {
092         return new UonParserSession(this);
093      }
094
095      /**
096       * Overrides the decoding flag on the context for this session.
097       *
098       * @param value The new value for this setting.
099       * @return This object.
100       */
101      @FluentSetter
102      public Builder decoding(boolean value) {
103         decoding = value;
104         return this;
105      }
106
107      // <FluentSetters>
108
109      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
110      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
111         super.apply(type, apply);
112         return this;
113      }
114
115      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
116      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
117         super.debug(value);
118         return this;
119      }
120
121      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
122      public Builder properties(Map<String,Object> value) {
123         super.properties(value);
124         return this;
125      }
126
127      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
128      public Builder property(String key, Object value) {
129         super.property(key, value);
130         return this;
131      }
132
133      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
134      public Builder unmodifiable() {
135         super.unmodifiable();
136         return this;
137      }
138
139      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
140      public Builder locale(Locale value) {
141         super.locale(value);
142         return this;
143      }
144
145      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
146      public Builder localeDefault(Locale value) {
147         super.localeDefault(value);
148         return this;
149      }
150
151      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
152      public Builder mediaType(MediaType value) {
153         super.mediaType(value);
154         return this;
155      }
156
157      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
158      public Builder mediaTypeDefault(MediaType value) {
159         super.mediaTypeDefault(value);
160         return this;
161      }
162
163      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
164      public Builder timeZone(TimeZone value) {
165         super.timeZone(value);
166         return this;
167      }
168
169      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
170      public Builder timeZoneDefault(TimeZone value) {
171         super.timeZoneDefault(value);
172         return this;
173      }
174
175      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
176      public Builder javaMethod(Method value) {
177         super.javaMethod(value);
178         return this;
179      }
180
181      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
182      public Builder outer(Object value) {
183         super.outer(value);
184         return this;
185      }
186
187      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
188      public Builder schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
189         super.schema(value);
190         return this;
191      }
192
193      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
194      public Builder schemaDefault(HttpPartSchema value) {
195         super.schemaDefault(value);
196         return this;
197      }
198
199      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParserSession.Builder */
200      public Builder fileCharset(Charset value) {
201         super.fileCharset(value);
202         return this;
203      }
204
205      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParserSession.Builder */
206      public Builder streamCharset(Charset value) {
207         super.streamCharset(value);
208         return this;
209      }
210
211      // </FluentSetters>
212   }
213
214   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
215   // Instance
216   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
217
218   private final UonParser ctx;
219   private final boolean decoding;
220
221   /**
222    * Constructor.
223    *
224    * @param builder The builder for this object.
225    */
226   protected UonParserSession(Builder builder) {
227      super(builder);
228      ctx = builder.ctx;
229      decoding = builder.decoding;
230   }
231
232   @Override /* ParserSession */
233   protected <T> T doParse(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
234      try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, decoding)) {
235         T o = parseAnything(type, r, getOuter(), true, null);
236         validateEnd(r);
237         return o;
238      }
239   }
240
241   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
242   protected <K,V> Map<K,V> doParseIntoMap(ParserPipe pipe, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws Exception {
243      try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, decoding)) {
244         m = parseIntoMap(r, m, (ClassMeta<K>)getClassMeta(keyType), (ClassMeta<V>)getClassMeta(valueType), null);
245         validateEnd(r);
246         return m;
247      }
248   }
249
250   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
251   protected <E> Collection<E> doParseIntoCollection(ParserPipe pipe, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws Exception {
252      try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, decoding)) {
253         c = parseIntoCollection(r, c, (ClassMeta<E>)getClassMeta(elementType), false, null);
254         validateEnd(r);
255         return c;
256      }
257   }
258
259   @Override /* HttpPartParser */
260   public <T> T parse(HttpPartType partType, HttpPartSchema schema, String in, ClassMeta<T> toType) throws ParseException, SchemaValidationException {
261      if (in == null)
262         return null;
263      if (toType.isString() && isNotEmpty(in)) {
264         // Shortcut - If we're returning a string and the value doesn't start with "'" or is "null", then
265         // just return the string since it's a plain value.
266         // This allows us to bypass the creation of a UonParserSession object.
267         char x = firstNonWhitespaceChar(in);
268         if (x != '\'' && x != 'n' && in.indexOf('~') == -1)
269            return (T)in;
270         if (x == 'n' && "null".equals(in))
271            return null;
272      }
273      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(in)) {
274         try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, false)) {
275            return parseAnything(toType, r, null, true, null);
276         }
277      } catch (ParseException e) {
278         throw e;
279      } catch (Exception e) {
280         throw new ParseException(e);
281      }
282   }
283
284   /**
285    * Workhorse method.
286    *
287    * @param <T> The class type being parsed, or <jk>null</jk> if unknown.
288    * @param eType The class type being parsed, or <jk>null</jk> if unknown.
289    * @param r The reader being parsed.
290    * @param outer The outer object (for constructing nested inner classes).
291    * @param isUrlParamValue
292    *    If <jk>true</jk>, then we're parsing a top-level URL-encoded value which is treated a bit different than the
293    *    default case.
294    * @param pMeta The current bean property being parsed.
295    * @return The parsed object.
296    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
297    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
298    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
299    */
300   public <T> T parseAnything(ClassMeta<?> eType, UonReader r, Object outer, boolean isUrlParamValue, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
301
302      if (eType == null)
303         eType = object();
304      ObjectSwap<T,Object> swap = (ObjectSwap<T,Object>)eType.getSwap(this);
305      BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)eType.getBuilderSwap(this);
306      ClassMeta<?> sType = null;
307      if (builder != null)
308         sType = builder.getBuilderClassMeta(this);
309      else if (swap != null)
310         sType = swap.getSwapClassMeta(this);
311      else
312         sType = eType;
313
314      if (sType.isOptional())
315         return (T)Utils.opt(parseAnything(eType.getElementType(), r, outer, isUrlParamValue, pMeta));
316
317      setCurrentClass(sType);
318
319      Object o = null;
320
321      int c = r.peekSkipWs();
322
323      if (c == -1 || c == AMP) {
324         // If parameter is blank and it's an array or collection, return an empty list.
325         if (sType.isCollectionOrArray())
326            o = sType.newInstance();
327         else if (sType.isString() || sType.isObject())
328            o = "";
329         else if (sType.isPrimitive())
330            o = sType.getPrimitiveDefault();
331         // Otherwise, leave null.
332      } else if (sType.isVoid()) {
333         String s = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
334         if (s != null)
335            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected ''null'' for void value, but was ''{0}''.", s);
336      } else if (sType.isObject()) {
337         if (c == '(') {
338            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
339            parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
340            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
341         } else if (c == '@') {
342            Collection l = new JsonList(this);
343            o = parseIntoCollection(r, l, sType, isUrlParamValue, pMeta);
344         } else {
345            String s = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
346            if (c != '\'') {
347               if ("true".equals(s) || "false".equals(s))
348                  o = Boolean.valueOf(s);
349               else if (! "null".equals(s)) {
350                  if (isNumeric(s))
351                     o = StringUtils.parseNumber(s, Number.class);
352                  else
353                     o = s;
354               }
355            } else {
356               o = s;
357            }
358         }
359      } else if (sType.isBoolean()) {
360         o = parseBoolean(r);
361      } else if (sType.isCharSequence()) {
362         o = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
363      } else if (sType.isChar()) {
364         o = parseCharacter(parseString(r, isUrlParamValue));
365      } else if (sType.isNumber()) {
366         o = parseNumber(r, (Class<? extends Number>)sType.getInnerClass());
367      } else if (sType.isMap()) {
368         Map m = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)sType.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(sType));
369         o = parseIntoMap(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
370      } else if (sType.isCollection()) {
371         if (c == '(') {
372            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
373            parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
374            // Handle case where it's a collection, but serialized as a map with a _type or _value key.
375            if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(sType)))
376               o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
377            // Handle case where it's a collection, but only a single value was specified.
378            else {
379               Collection l = (
380                  sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer)
381                  ? (Collection)sType.newInstance(outer)
382                  : new JsonList(this)
383               );
384               l.add(m.cast(sType.getElementType()));
385               o = l;
386            }
387         } else {
388            Collection l = (
389               sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer)
390               ? (Collection)sType.newInstance(outer)
391               : new JsonList(this)
392            );
393            o = parseIntoCollection(r, l, sType, isUrlParamValue, pMeta);
394         }
395      } else if (builder != null) {
396         BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, eType));
397         m = parseIntoBeanMap(r, m);
398         o = m == null ? null : builder.build(this, m.getBean(), eType);
399      } else if (sType.canCreateNewBean(outer)) {
400         BeanMap m = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass());
401         m = parseIntoBeanMap(r, m);
402         o = m == null ? null : m.getBean();
403      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer)) {
404         String s = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
405         if (s != null)
406            o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, s);
407      } else if (sType.isArray() || sType.isArgs()) {
408         if (c == '(') {
409            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
410            parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
411            // Handle case where it's an array, but serialized as a map with a _type or _value key.
412            if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(sType)))
413               o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
414            // Handle case where it's an array, but only a single value was specified.
415            else {
416               ArrayList l = Utils.listOfSize(1);
417               l.add(m.cast(sType.getElementType()));
418               o = toArray(sType, l);
419            }
420         } else {
421            ArrayList l = (ArrayList)parseIntoCollection(r, list(), sType, isUrlParamValue, pMeta);
422            o = toArray(sType, l);
423         }
424      } else if (c == '(') {
425         // It could be a non-bean with _type attribute.
426         JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
427         parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
428         if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(sType)))
429            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
430         else if (sType.getProxyInvocationHandler() != null)
431            o = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass()).load(m).getBean();
432         else
433            throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
434               sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
435      } else if (c == 'n') {
436         r.read(); // NOSONAR - Intentional.
437         parseNull(r);
438      } else {
439         throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
440            sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
441      }
442
443      if (o == null && sType.isPrimitive())
444         o = sType.getPrimitiveDefault();
445      if (swap != null && o != null)
446         o = unswap(swap, o, eType);
447
448      if (outer != null)
449         setParent(eType, o, outer);
450
451      return (T)o;
452   }
453
454   private <K,V> Map<K,V> parseIntoMap(UonReader r, Map<K,V> m, ClassMeta<K> keyType, ClassMeta<V> valueType,
455         BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
456
457      if (keyType == null)
458         keyType = (ClassMeta<K>)string();
459
460      int c = r.read();
461      if (c == -1 || c == AMP)
462         return null;
463      if (c == 'n')
464         return (Map<K,V>)parseNull(r);
465      if (c != '(')
466         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '(' at beginning of object.");
467
468      final int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
469      final int S2=2; // Found attrName end, looking for =.
470      final int S3=3; // Found =, looking for valStart.
471      final int S4=4; // Looking for , or )
472      boolean isInEscape = false;
473
474      int state = S1;
475      K currAttr = null;
476      while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
477         c = r.read();
478         if (! isInEscape) {
479            if (state == S1) {
480               if (c == ')')
481                  return m;
482               if (Character.isWhitespace(c))
483                  skipSpace(r);
484               else {
485                  r.unread();
486                  Object attr = parseAttr(r, decoding);
487                  currAttr = attr == null ? null : convertAttrToType(m, trim(attr.toString()), keyType);
488                  state = S2;
489                  c = 0; // Avoid isInEscape if c was '\'
490               }
491            } else if (state == S2) {
492               if (c == EQ || c == '=')
493                  state = S3;
494               else if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
495                  if (currAttr == null) {
496                     // Value was '%00'
497                     r.unread();
498                     return null;
499                  }
500                  m.put(currAttr, null);
501                  if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP)
502                     return m;
503                  state = S1;
504               }
505            } else if (state == S3) {
506               if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
507                  V value = convertAttrToType(m, "", valueType);
508                  m.put(currAttr, value);
509                  if (c == -1 || c == ')' || c == AMP)
510                     return m;
511                  state = S1;
512               } else  {
513                  V value = parseAnything(valueType, r.unread(), m, false, pMeta);
514                  setName(valueType, value, currAttr);
515                  m.put(currAttr, value);
516                  state = S4;
517                  c = 0; // Avoid isInEscape if c was '\'
518               }
519            } else if (state == S4) {
520               if (c == ',')
521                  state = S1;
522               else if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
523                  return m;
524               }
525            }
526         }
527         isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
528      }
529      if (state == S1)
530         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on object.");
531      if (state == S2)
532         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '=' following attribute name on object.");
533      if (state == S3)
534         throw new ParseException(this, "Dangling '=' found in object entry");
535      if (state == S4)
536         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ')' marking end of object.");
537
538      return null; // Unreachable.
539   }
540
541   private <E> Collection<E> parseIntoCollection(UonReader r, Collection<E> l, ClassMeta<E> type, boolean isUrlParamValue, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
542
543      int c = r.readSkipWs();
544      if (c == -1 || c == AMP)
545         return null;
546      if (c == 'n')
547         return (Collection<E>)parseNull(r);
548
549      int argIndex = 0;
550
551      // If we're parsing a top-level parameter, we're allowed to have comma-delimited lists outside parenthesis (e.g. "&foo=1,2,3&bar=a,b,c")
552      // This is not allowed at lower levels since we use comma's as end delimiters.
553      boolean isInParens = (c == '@');
554      if (! isInParens) {
555         if (isUrlParamValue)
556            r.unread();
557         else
558            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '(' marking beginning of collection.");
559      } else {
560         r.read();  // NOSONAR - Intentional, we're skipping the '@' character.
561      }
562
563      if (isInParens) {
564         final int S1=1; // Looking for starting of first entry.
565         final int S2=2; // Looking for starting of subsequent entries.
566         final int S3=3; // Looking for , or ) after first entry.
567
568         int state = S1;
569         while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
570            c = r.read();
571            if (state == S1 || state == S2) {
572               if (c == ')') {
573                  if (state == S2) {
574                     l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(),
575                           r.unread(), l, false, pMeta));
576                     r.read();  // NOSONAR - Intentional, we're skipping the ')' character.
577                  }
578                  return l;
579               } else if (Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
580                  skipSpace(r);
581               } else {
582                  l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(),
583                        r.unread(), l, false, pMeta));
584                  state = S3;
585               }
586            } else if (state == S3) {
587               if (c == ',') {
588                  state = S2;
589               } else if (c == ')') {
590                  return l;
591               }
592            }
593         }
594         if (state == S1 || state == S2)
595            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find start of entry in array.");
596         if (state == S3)
597            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find end of entry in array.");
598
599      } else {
600         final int S1=1; // Looking for starting of entry.
601         final int S2=2; // Looking for , or & or END after first entry.
602
603         int state = S1;
604         while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
605            c = r.read();
606            if (state == S1) {
607               if (Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
608                  skipSpace(r);
609               } else {
610                  l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(),
611                        r.unread(), l, false, pMeta));
612                  state = S2;
613               }
614            } else if (state == S2) {
615               if (c == ',') {
616                  state = S1;
617               } else if (Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
618                  skipSpace(r);
619               } else if (c == AMP || c == -1) {
620                  r.unread();
621                  return l;
622               }
623            }
624         }
625      }
626
627      return null;  // Unreachable.
628   }
629
630   private <T> BeanMap<T> parseIntoBeanMap(UonReader r, BeanMap<T> m) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
631
632      int c = r.readSkipWs();
633      if (c == -1 || c == AMP)
634         return null;
635      if (c == 'n')
636         return (BeanMap<T>)parseNull(r);
637      if (c != '(')
638         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '(' at beginning of object.");
639
640      final int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
641      final int S2=2; // Found attrName end, looking for =.
642      final int S3=3; // Found =, looking for valStart.
643      final int S4=4; // Looking for , or }
644      boolean isInEscape = false;
645
646      int state = S1;
647      String currAttr = "";
648      mark();
649      try {
650         while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
651            c = r.read();
652            if (! isInEscape) {
653               if (state == S1) {
654                  if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
655                     return m;
656                  }
657                  if (Character.isWhitespace(c))
658                     skipSpace(r);
659                  else {
660                     r.unread();
661                     mark();
662                     currAttr = parseAttrName(r, decoding);
663                     if (currAttr == null) { // Value was '%00'
664                        return null;
665                     }
666                     state = S2;
667                  }
668               } else if (state == S2) {
669                  if (c == EQ || c == '=')
670                     state = S3;
671                  else if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
672                     m.put(currAttr, null);
673                     if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
674                        return m;
675                     }
676                     state = S1;
677                  }
678               } else if (state == S3) {
679                  if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
680                     if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
681                        BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
682                        if (pMeta == null) {
683                           onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, null);
684                           unmark();
685                        } else {
686                           unmark();
687                           Object value = convertToType("", pMeta.getClassMeta());
688                           try {
689                              pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
690                           } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
691                              onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
692                              throw e;
693                           }
694                        }
695                     }
696                     if (c == -1 || c == ')' || c == AMP)
697                        return m;
698                     state = S1;
699                  } else {
700                     if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
701                        BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
702                        if (pMeta == null) {
703                           onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, parseAnything(object(), r.unread(), m.getBean(false), false, null));
704                           unmark();
705                        } else {
706                           unmark();
707                           setCurrentProperty(pMeta);
708                           ClassMeta<?> cm = pMeta.getClassMeta();
709                           Object value = parseAnything(cm, r.unread(), m.getBean(false), false, pMeta);
710                           setName(cm, value, currAttr);
711                           try {
712                              pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
713                           } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
714                              onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
715                              throw e;
716                           }
717                           setCurrentProperty(null);
718                        }
719                     }
720                     state = S4;
721                  }
722               } else if (state == S4) {
723                  if (c == ',')
724                     state = S1;
725                  else if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
726                     return m;
727                  }
728               }
729            }
730            isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
731         }
732         if (state == S1)
733            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on object.");
734         if (state == S2)
735            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '=' following attribute name on object.");
736         if (state == S3)
737            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find value following '=' on object.");
738         if (state == S4)
739            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ')' marking end of object.");
740      } finally {
741         unmark();
742      }
743
744      return null; // Unreachable.
745   }
746
747   private Object parseNull(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
748      String s = parseString(r, false);
749      if ("ull".equals(s))
750         return null;
751      throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected character sequence: ''{0}''", s);
752   }
753
754   /**
755    * Convenience method for parsing an attribute from the specified parser.
756    *
757    * @param r The reader.
758    * @param encoded Whether the attribute is encoded.
759    * @return The parsed object
760    * @throws IOException Exception thrown by underlying stream.
761    * @throws ParseException Attribute was malformed.
762    */
763   protected final Object parseAttr(UonReader r, boolean encoded) throws IOException, ParseException {
764      Object attr;
765      attr = parseAttrName(r, encoded);
766      return attr;
767   }
768
769   /**
770    * Parses an attribute name from the specified reader.
771    *
772    * @param r The reader.
773    * @param encoded Whether the attribute is encoded.
774    * @return The parsed attribute name.
775    * @throws IOException Exception thrown by underlying stream.
776    * @throws ParseException Attribute name was malformed.
777    */
778   protected final String parseAttrName(UonReader r, boolean encoded) throws IOException, ParseException {
779
780      // If string is of form 'xxx', we're looking for ' at the end.
781      // Otherwise, we're looking for '&' or '=' or WS or -1 denoting the end of this string.
782
783      int c = r.peekSkipWs();
784      if (c == '\'')
785         return parsePString(r);
786
787      r.mark();
788      boolean isInEscape = false;
789      if (encoded) {
790         while (c != -1) {
791            c = r.read();
792            if (! isInEscape) {
793               if (c == AMP || c == EQ || c == -1 || Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
794                  if (c != -1)
795                     r.unread();
796                  String s = r.getMarked();
797                  return ("null".equals(s) ? null : s);
798               }
799            }
800            else if (c == AMP)
801               r.replace('&');
802            else if (c == EQ)
803               r.replace('=');
804            isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
805         }
806      } else {
807         while (c != -1) {
808            c = r.read();
809            if (! isInEscape) {
810               if (c == '=' || c == -1 || Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
811                  if (c != -1)
812                     r.unread();
813                  String s = r.getMarked();
814                  return ("null".equals(s) ? null : trim(s));
815               }
816            }
817            isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
818         }
819      }
820
821      // We should never get here.
822      throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected condition.");
823   }
824
825
826   /*
827    * Returns true if the next character in the stream is preceded by an escape '~' character.
828    */
829   private static final boolean isInEscape(int c, ParserReader r, boolean prevIsInEscape) throws IOException {
830      if (c == '~' && ! prevIsInEscape) {
831         c = r.peek();
832         if (escapedChars.contains(c)) {
833            r.delete();
834            return true;
835         }
836      }
837      return false;
838   }
839
840   /**
841    * Parses a string value from the specified reader.
842    *
843    * @param r The input reader.
844    * @param isUrlParamValue Whether this is a URL parameter.
845    * @return The parsed string.
846    * @throws IOException Exception thrown by underlying stream.
847    * @throws ParseException Malformed input found.
848    */
849   protected final String parseString(UonReader r, boolean isUrlParamValue) throws IOException, ParseException {
850
851      // If string is of form 'xxx', we're looking for ' at the end.
852      // Otherwise, we're looking for ',' or ')' or -1 denoting the end of this string.
853
854      int c = r.peekSkipWs();
855      if (c == '\'')
856         return parsePString(r);
857
858      r.mark();
859      boolean isInEscape = false;
860      String s = null;
861      AsciiSet endChars = (isUrlParamValue ? endCharsParam : endCharsNormal);
862      while (c != -1) {
863         c = r.read();
864         if (! isInEscape) {
865            // If this is a URL parameter value, we're looking for:  &
866            // If not, we're looking for:  &,)
867            if (endChars.contains(c)) {
868               r.unread();
869               c = -1;
870            }
871         }
872         if (c == -1)
873            s = r.getMarked();
874         else if (c == EQ)
875            r.replace('=');
876         else if (Character.isWhitespace(c) && ! isUrlParamValue) {
877            s = r.getMarked(0, -1);
878            skipSpace(r);
879            c = -1;
880         }
881         isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
882      }
883
884      if (isUrlParamValue)
885         s = StringUtils.trim(s);
886
887      return ("null".equals(s) ? null : trim(s));
888   }
889
890   private static final AsciiSet endCharsParam = AsciiSet.of(""+AMP), endCharsNormal = AsciiSet.of(",)"+AMP);
891
892
893   /*
894    * Parses a string of the form "'foo'"
895    * All whitespace within parenthesis are preserved.
896    */
897   private String parsePString(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
898
899      r.read(); // Skip first quote, NOSONAR - Intentional.
900      r.mark();
901      int c = 0;
902
903      boolean isInEscape = false;
904      while (c != -1) {
905         c = r.read();
906         if (! isInEscape) {
907            if (c == '\'')
908               return trim(r.getMarked(0, -1));
909         }
910         if (c == EQ)
911            r.replace('=');
912         isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
913      }
914      throw new ParseException(this, "Unmatched parenthesis");
915   }
916
917   private Boolean parseBoolean(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
918      String s = parseString(r, false);
919      if (s == null || s.equals("null"))
920         return null;
921      if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("true"))
922         return true;
923      if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("false"))
924         return false;
925      throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax for boolean.  ''{0}''.", s);
926   }
927
928   private Number parseNumber(UonReader r, Class<? extends Number> c) throws IOException, ParseException {
929      String s = parseString(r, false);
930      if (s == null)
931         return null;
932      return StringUtils.parseNumber(s, c);
933   }
934
935   /*
936    * Call this method after you've finished a parsing a string to make sure that if there's any
937    * remainder in the input, that it consists only of whitespace and comments.
938    */
939   private void validateEnd(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
940      if (! isValidateEnd())
941         return;
942      while (true) {
943         int c = r.read();
944         if (c == -1)
945            return;
946         if (! Character.isWhitespace(c))
947            throw new ParseException(this, "Remainder after parse: ''{0}''.", (char)c);
948      }
949   }
950
951   private static void skipSpace(ParserReader r) throws IOException {
952      int c = 0;
953      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
954         if (c <= 2 || ! Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
955            r.unread();
956            return;
957         }
958      }
959   }
960
961   /**
962    * Creates a {@link UonReader} from the specified parser pipe.
963    *
964    * @param pipe The parser input.
965    * @param decodeChars Whether the reader should automatically decode URL-encoded characters.
966    * @return A new {@link UonReader} object.
967    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
968    */
969   public final UonReader getUonReader(ParserPipe pipe, boolean decodeChars) throws IOException {
970      Reader r = pipe.getReader();
971      if (r instanceof UonReader)
972         return (UonReader)r;
973      return new UonReader(pipe, decodeChars);
974   }
975
976   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
977   // Properties
978   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
979
980   /**
981    * Decode <js>"%xx"</js> sequences.
982    *
983    * @see UonParser.Builder#decoding()
984    * @return
985    *    <jk>true</jk> if URI encoded characters should be decoded, <jk>false</jk> if they've already been decoded
986    *    before being passed to this parser.
987    */
988   protected final boolean isDecoding() {
989      return decoding;
990   }
991
992   /**
993    * Validate end.
994    *
995    * @see UonParser.Builder#validateEnd()
996    * @return
997    *    <jk>true</jk> if after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
998    *    the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
999    */
1000   protected final boolean isValidateEnd() {
1001      return ctx.isValidateEnd();
1002   }
1003
1004   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1005   // Other methods
1006   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1007
1008   @Override /* ContextSession */
1009   protected JsonMap properties() {
1010      return filteredMap("decoding", decoding);
1011   }
1012}
